required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Pre-event Massage Over the Neuromuscular Response
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Pre-event Massage Over the Neuromuscular Response of Gastrocnemius Muscles

brief_summary.textblock: The study observes the effect of a pre-event massage on the gastrocnemius muscles over the neuromuscular response of the gastrocnemious muscles.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 minutes before the intervention, and 8 minutes after the intervention
primary_outcome.description: Time between an electric impulse and 10% of the contraction of the muscle that is being excited with an electric impulse, using an electromyography test (miliseconds).

primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 minutes before the intervention, and 8 minutes after the intervention
primary_outcome.description: Time between 10% and 90% of the contraction of the muscle that is being excited with an electric impulse, using an electromyography test (miliseconds).

primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 minutes before the intervention, and 8 minutes after the intervention
primary_outcome.description: time between 50% of the contraction and 50% of the relaxation of the muscle after being impulsed with an electric impulse, using an electromyography test (miliseconds).

primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 minutes before the intervention, and 8 minutes after the intervention
primary_outcome.description: time between 90% and 50% of the relaxation of the muscle after being impulsed with an electric impulse, using an electromyography test (miliseconds).

primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 minutes before the intervention, and 8 minutes after the intervention
primary_outcome.description: Maximal displacement of the muscle after being excited with an electric impulse, using an electromyography test (miliseconds).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8 minutes before the intervention, and 2 minutes after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Isometric strength of the gastrocnemious muscles using a handheld dynamometer "microFET 2" (newtons).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 minutes before the intervention, and 4 minutes after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Passive range of motion of the ankle dorsiflexion, using an inclinometer (degrees).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes before the intervention, and 1 minute after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum jump height with one leg using the application "My Jump 2" (centimeters).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 minute before the intervention, and 5 minute after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Resistance to an external force that deforms its initial shape, using a "Myoton".

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 minute before the intervention, and 5 minute after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Capacity to recover its initial shape after the removal of the external force that lead to its deformation, using a "Myoton".

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 minute before the intervention, and 5 minute after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Time for a muscle to recover its shape from deformation after the removal of an external force, using a "Myoton" (miliseconds).

intervention.description: Five minutes massage, combining superficial and high-frequency techniques of massage applied with the therapist hands

criteria.textblock:
Exclusion Criteria:
- Muscle injury in the last two months
- To not understand the study orders
- Suffer a musculoskeletal disorder that doesn't allow the subject to do the study protocol
